messages.content: I have been a Labour MP for 14 years. I joined the Labour Party as a teenager, I was a councillor and an adviser to the last Labour government. The Labour Party has been my life and until this year I could never have dreamt of voting for anyone else, so it really has come to something when I can no longer ask you to vote Labour.
I could never ask anyone to make Jeremy Corbyn Prime Minister. I am decent, traditional Labour, but I think he is completely unfit to lead our country.
The Labour Party has been poisoned by racism, extremism and intolerance under his leadership.
No one thinks he will deliver Brexit and at a time when working people need support, Jeremy Corbyn and John McDonnell have come up with plans that will put businesses, investment and jobs at risk.
And I am worried that if Boris Johnson does not get a majority, the SNP will back Corbyn.
It is too big a risk. That is why I think we should lend the Tories our votes and stop Jeremy Corbyn getting anywhere near Downing Street.
This hasn't been an easy decision. But it's the right one. And I encourage you to vote the same way.
The only way to get a Government led by Boris Johnson so that we can get Brexit done, is to vote Conservative here in Vale of Glamorgan.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Jeremy Corbyn, Boris Johnson, John McDonnell
mentions.tacticalSituation: Lend the Tories our votes to stop Jeremy Corbyn; Concern that without a Conservative majority, the SNP will back Corbyn

issues.brexitEurope: The only way to get a Government led by Boris Johnson so that we can get Brexit done, is to vote Conservative here in Vale of Glamorgan.
issues.economy: Working people need support, plans by Jeremy Corbyn and John McDonnell will put businesses, investment and jobs at risk.
issues.governance: Labour Party has been poisoned by racism, extremism and intolerance under Jeremy Corbyn's leadership.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have been a Labour MP for 14 years. I joined the Labour Party as a teenager, I was a councillor and an adviser to the last Labour government.
leaflet.additionalNotes: Ian Austin is endorsing the Conservative Party and not running as a candidate.
